title: Area Sports: Golf ace, H.S. tennis & soccer; JV, middle school & flag football
text: Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 9:21 PM Updated at 9:25 PM Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 9:21 PM Updated at 9:25 PM Golf ace Jacob Sigmon recorded a hole-in-one playing this week at the Cleveland Country Club. Sigmon used an 8-iron to register his golfing gem on the 139-yard, par-three No. 3 hole. It was Sigmon’s third hole-in-one to date. High School Tennis Kings Mountain 5, Crest 3 – The Lady Mountaineers ran their record to 11-0 with a tough win over county and SMAC rival Crest. Kings Mountain owned a 4-2 edge after singles. The highlight of the match was a showdown between unbeaten singles competitors Lauren Scism of Crest and Kings Mountain freshman Natalie Lutz. The first set went to Lutz 7-5, but Scism fought back for a 7-6 (9-7 tiebreaker) to pull even. In the final set, another tiebreaker was needed and the Charger senior pulled down 10-6 victory over Lutz. The Mountaineers clinched the match with a 10-8 win at the No. 3 doubles. Kings Mountain was to play at Shelby Thursday. High School Soccer Crest 2, R-S Central 0 -- Zach Sandifer and Caleb Tanner scored goals on assists by George Odembo for the Chargers, now 7-7 overall and 6-5 in league play. Jonathon Beatty was in goal for the shutout. Crest will host East Rutherford in a JV/varsity twinbill on Monday beginning at 5:30 p.m. JV football Shelby 48, East Rutherford 0 – The junior Golden Lions got four first-half touchdown passes from Malik Surratt in running their record to 6-1 on the year. Maleek McMullens was on the receiving end of two of those scoring tosses and also caught a 2-point conversion. Nathan Kee and Jahlen Cannon also were on the receiving end for touchdowns. Lathan Kee and Nathan Kee had rushing touchdowns and Quadrick Heckstall returned a fumble for a score. Surratt ran for a 2-point conversion and Zachary Ledbetter kicked an extra point. Other scores: Burns defeated Cherryville, 20-8; Kings Mountain out-scored Crest, 48-36. (Will update when more info available.) Middle School football Kings Mountain 42, East Lincoln 22 – The 4-0 Patriots zoomed to a 28-14 halftime lead. Ricaylen Mack had touchdown runs of 59, 75, 48 and 3 yards, winding up with more than 200 yards of total offense. He also caught a 28-yard scoring pass from Devin Presley, who threw a pair of 2-point conversion passes to Bryce Fisher. Pressley also ran for a 2-point conversions. Titus Clark had a 52-yard scoring run for the victors. Issac Watson paced the Kings Mountain defensive effort. The Patriots play at Burns next Wednesday. Crest 38, Chase 0 – The Dragons improved to 3-1 overall and 2-0 in conference play with the win. Jalin Graham rushed for three touchdowns and a 2-point conversion for the Dragons. Je’Vionne Livingston caught a scoring pass from Matt Cray and also returned an interception for a score for Crest. Donye Fuller and James Ussery also added conversion runs. Page 2 of 2 - Chris Richardson and Nekeus Clyde sparked the shutout defensive effort for the Dragons, who play Oct. 14 at Shelby. Shelby City Park Flag Football Cowboys 34, Falcons 19 – Immanuel Collins scored three touchdowns and added a conversion, with teammate Tyler Morgan scoring a pair of touchdowns and two conversions for the victors. Dezmond Heine also chipped in with a conversion for the Cowboys. Kinglei Wray provided two touchdowns runs and a conversion for the Falcons with Isaiah Baldwin contributing a scoring run. Panthers 27, Titans 12 – Key’non Surratt rushed for three touchdowns with Jayden Harris adding a touchdown run and a conversion for the Panthers. Calvin Bradley and Ja’Carl Martin also supplied conversions for the victors. Alex Shelton ran for two touchdowns for the Titans. By Staff reports
